definition: it is obvious that.../as one can well imagine...
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to know/to be aware

sentences.english: I called her to share my findings and she was, understandably, creeped out.
sentences.chinese: 我打电话告诉她我的发现，可想而知，她吓坏了。

sentences.english: Obviously, the pouch doesn't work exactly the same as the colon.
sentences.chinese: 可想而知，袋状小肠并不能完全像结肠一样运行。

sentences.english: I´m sure you can easily imagine how much typing this saves.
sentences.chinese: 可想而知这样会少打很多字。

sentences.english: Such a face value of the car, pull the wind out of the street level as can be imagined.
sentences.chinese: 这样一款颜值的车，可想而知出街的拉风程度。

sentences.english: He has left home for years. We can imagine how much he misses his hometown.
sentences.chinese: 他离家多年，怀乡的心情是可想而知的。

sentences.english: Understandably, this causes a great deal of disk activity on each request.
sentences.chinese: 可想而知，这会使每次请求都导致大量磁盘操作。

definition: it goes without saying/it is self-evident
from this, it can be seen that...
no less than/not inferior to
not to mention/leaving aside
it goes to show that/one can see
equivalent to/appropriate/considerably/to a certain extent/fairly/quite
surpassing by far
it can clearly be seen (that this is the case)/it is (thus) clear/clear/visible
needless to say/it goes without saying
to think about it
extremely
to not need dwell on (idiom)
unprecedented
to know well/to be fully aware of
fear/to dread/I'm afraid that.../perhaps/maybe
how old?/how big?/how much?/so big/that much
